page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY/MIDDLETON
page.content: The Council houses on Lancaster Road, previously Tunstall Lane,paid dues of 1 shilling per year,until recently to the church.Yanham Lane,called Â£Dog KennelÂ£by the locals,has an old stone building,formerly for the manorÂ£s hunting dogs.In Victorian times,when Morecambe was a popular resort,visitors came to Overton in droves by landau or charabanc,to see the boatbuilders,or the famous Â£Pleasure GardensÂ£at the Globe Hotel.Â£MaÂ£Mcluskie of the Ship Hotel,was a local character,with trilby hat,corn-cob pipe,and her collection of birdÂ£s eggs.Her pub is still there,as are her eggs,and her trilby hat is still worn by the local artist.
